API Reference¶

A collected description of each .py file and what they do.

main.py¶

main.update(display)¶

graph.py¶

class graph.Graph(update_main)¶

(Mostly) an abstract base class for the graphs on display.

fetch_data()¶

Retrieve relevant data from Refinitiv based on the current control status.

get_controls()¶
Returns:

The control widgets as a single DOM element.

get_plot()¶
Returns:

The plot as a single DOM element.

init_controls()¶

Initialize the control widgets for the graph and retrieve a snapshot of the default control status.

preprocess()¶

Perform calculations based on the raw data from Refinitiv to derive additional data as required and facilitate graphing.

render()¶

Render the interactive plot using Bokeh.

update()¶

Retrieve the current control status, update the graph accordingly, then propagate the change to the main interface.

heatmap.py¶

class heatmap.Heatmap(update_main)¶

Inherits from Graph. It’s API handling and data processing and graphing all in one.

activate_update()¶

Make the Show Results button clickable again!

fetch_data()¶

Retrieve relevant data from Refinitiv based on the current control status.

get_controls()¶
Returns:

The control widgets as a single DOM element.

get_plot()¶
Returns:

The plot as a single DOM element.

init_controls()¶

Initialize the control widgets for the graph and retrieve a snapshot of the default control status.

preprocess()¶

Perform calculations based on the raw data from Refinitiv to derive additional data as required and facilitate graphing.

render()¶

Render the interactive plot using Bokeh.

update()¶

Retrieve the current control status, update the graph accordingly, then propagate the change to the main interface.

heatmap_controls.py¶

class heatmap_controls.HeatmapControls(update_graph)¶

Contain control widgets for the heatmap and implement control logic.

general_change_handler(attr, old, new)¶

Make update button clickable after changes to control status.

get_status()¶

Return a dictionary of the current control status.

group_var_handler(attr, old, new)¶

Currently not in use.

Can potentially be revived, if we want to allow each block to contain information on one specific score from one specific asset, within a limited universe e.g. a single sector. This would allow the user to see the bigger picture from a bigger universe.

scope_handler(attr, old, new)¶

Propagate changes to other widgets after the scope of the graph has been changed.

update_handler()¶

Disable the update button and initiate the update of graph.

timeseries.py¶

class timeseries.TimeSeries(update_main)¶

Inherits from Graph. It’s API handling and data processing and graphing all in one.

activate_update()¶

Make the Show Results button clickable again!

fetch_data()¶

Retrieve relevant data from Refinitiv based on the current control status.

get_controls()¶
Returns:

The control widgets as a single DOM element.

get_plot()¶
Returns:

The plot as a single DOM element.

init_controls()¶

Initialize the control widgets for the graph and retrieve a snapshot of the default control status.

preprocess()¶

Perform calculations based on the raw data from Refinitiv to derive additional data as required and facilitate graphing.

render()¶

Render the interactive plot using Bokeh.

update()¶

Retrieve the current control status, update the graph accordingly, then propagate the change to the main interface.

timeseries_controls.py¶

class timeseries_controls.TimeSeriesControls(update_graph)¶

Contain control widgets for the time series and implement control logic.

general_change_handler(attr, old, new)¶

Make update button clickable after changes to control status.

get_status()¶

Return a dictionary of the current control status.

update_handler()¶

Disable the update button and initiate the update of graph.

api.py¶

Currently only offer access to the API key. Nothing else!

params.py¶

Wrapper for access to pickled files.

params_update.py¶

Update the stored pickles.

params_update.make_pickles(var, var_name)¶

Make a pickle out of the item passed in and store it under ./Dashboard/lib/ with the same name.

utilities.py¶

Contains various utility functions and some related data for easy access.

utilities.color_fader(c1, c2, mix=0)¶

Performs linear interpolation from colors c1 (at mix=0) to c2 (mix=1), both given as hex codes.

utilities.color_gradient(c1, c2, steps=0)¶

Returns a list of hex codes from c1 to c2, with the number of specified steps in-between.
